Dear Optimists,Optimism Fractal is returning from summer break and we’re excited to embark on Season 4! We’re looking forward to reconnecting at our weekly events and invite you to join!Optimism Fractal events kick off with our belovedRespect Game, which always provides a great time to collaborate with builders on the Superchain, raise awareness for your work, and build your reputation in the Optimism Collective. I’m so grateful for everyone who helped make the past three seasons so special and am stoked for all the amazing experiences the community will share at Optimism Fractal events in this season. I encourage you to invite friends and register on theevents calendar, where you can also find weekly Optimism Town Hall and Eden Fractal events.At this week’s Optimism Town Hall I propose that we plan Optimism Fractal’s fourth season with an open discussion. We can reflect on our achievements so far, share updates from over the break, discuss goals for Season 4, and consider topics for future town hall events. Optimism Fractal is well-positioned to make significant strides in achieving our core intents and integrate more deeply with the Collective. You can vote on thetopic proposaland see how we choose topics at the town hallhere.Join us to connect, share your thoughts, and help actualize the Optimistic Vision in our fourth season. I’m excited to hear from everyone and take our next steps together. If you’re not yet familiar with Optimism Fractal, please exploreOptimismFractal.comto learn more and discover how we can collaborate. If you’d like to review our progress from last season, you can see thisthreadand watch our recentvideos.The first events of the season are on Thursday, August 15th and we’ll meet each week on Thursday at 17 UTC after that. Looking forward to seeing you there!optimism fractal sunny flower rainbow square 1694×694 90.1 KB

Article Name: Optimism Community Call Recaps & Recordings Thread
Article Content: Hi Optimists!I am creating this thread as a central location to contain all of our community call recordings and recaps. The goal is for people to be able to review past community calls more easily. And see the things we’ve discussed over time.From this point on, check here to find all recap/recordings!Michael

Superchain Product VisionLasted Updated October 8, 2024 This is a living document.Optimism is here to scale Ethereum technology and values & build an internet that benefits all, and is owned by all.No matter what happens to the market, it’s core to Optimism’s identity and strategy that we remain decentralized, open source, and focused on scaling.The Superchain is a network of chains/platforms, each with its own sovereignty, yet all united by Optimism Governance. That means Optimism’s core customer is the platform developer – businesses or projects deploying OP Chains to build their own ecosystems, and by extension their customers - application developers and end users. A scaled Ethereum - trillions in GDP, billions of users, and millions of developers - requires some core principles to outline the product the Optimism Collective is building together.This is the Foundation’s vision for the Superchain over the next two years. Executing on this vision will require collaboration among all of the Collective’s contributors.Standardization of chains enables decentralization and composability at scaleChains benefit from shared governance of upgrades and securityAll chains areStage 2, free from control by any one actor, and all upgrade keys are managed by governanceChains cancustomize non-protocol featuressuch as fee marginsThe Superchain starts as 15-50 chains that feel like one, and scales to 1000+Every transaction is sub-second and sub-centPlatform ecosystems can scale by launching multiple chainsIndividual chains are abstracted away to enable seamless UXGovernance protects the security of the SuperchainGovernance ensures the safety of user funds and liveness of each OP Chain in the SuperchainVoting is legitimate, capture resistant, and representative of the Collective’s primary stakeholders – decisions are made with input by those who are impacted by themStage 2 ensures every individual user’s right to exit Optimism-governed blockspaceGovernance creates a flywheel of sustainable growth and developmentGovernance incentivizes the development and maintenance of public goods that benefit all OP Chains, application developers, or usersGovernance supports the growth of the Superchain economy, and makes sustainable economy policy decisions such as inflation and resource allocationGovernance protects the Collective against rent-seeking and other extractive business modelsSpecial thanks to members of theCollective Feedback Commissionfor review and valuable feedback on early drafts of this document.

Hi all - duncand fromBoardroomherePart of our team’s mission is to increase informed participation in governance, and as a project supporting Optimism voters we thought it would be useful to provide a weekly recap of recent governance activity in the Optimism community. While the Foundation releases a fantastic generalweekly recap, we feel a governance-focused summary will be useful for delegates and voters due to the rapid pace of governance news and updates. When appropriate we’ll also note a few specific areas for action on timely subjects.Within our weekly recap, we’ll provide a look back at:ProposalsGovernance changesImpactful operating suggestions, andCritical governance-related discussions across Discourse, Twitter, and Discord.The recap is intended to provide an overview of what’s happening in governance and easy access to the most critical information—so that it’s easy to stay up-to-date and make informed decisions.The first recap will be posted today. We’d love to hear your feedback and any suggestions you have!

Article Name: Token House Call will be [Tuesday, October 22nd @ 11:00 PT / 14:00 ET / 18:00 GMT / 20:00 CET]
Article Content: Hello Token House!We will be having our next call on Tuesday, October 22nd.@ben-chainwill be joining to discuss blockspace charters, including somenew updatesto the standard charter.We also have some new delegates introducing themselves and a lot more to cover from the past two weeks!Meet link:https://meet.google.com/vme-ovto-jcnJointhcc16dcc (1) (1)912×365 37.3 KBSee you there,Michael

gm Optimism CollectiveLast week, forum activity increased with 23 topics from 14 the previous week. Below are several standout discussions, selected for their impact on Optimism’s growth and innovation.Superchain Product VisionCreated by:@SuperchainEcoThis post outlines the product vision for Superchain, a unified Ethereum-based network governed by Optimism. It focuses on creating scalable, decentralized systems with strong governance mechanisms and collaboration among contributors. The vision aims to set a foundation for developers and users to build and thrive within the Superchain ecosystem, emphasizing security and growth.Cycle 28 Grants Final RoundupCreated by:@Gonna.ethThis post reviews the achievements of Cycle 28, with 32 approved applications from a total of 53 submissions. Mint Blockchain was highlighted for securing a Superchain grant. The roundup emphasizes the success of the grants process and the ongoing support for innovative projects within the Optimism ecosystem. A new mission request is now open for applications, providing further opportunities for contributors.Create your own Developer Reputation Scores - OpenRank Web Tool IntroCreated by:@gloriakwThis post introduces the OpenRank Web Tool, which allows users to create customized developer reputation scores based on activity in GitHub repositories. By using trust signals and ranking criteria, contributors can generate reputation scores to better assess developer contributions within the OP Stack ecosystem. This tool offers valuable insights for voters assessing projects in Retro Funding rounds.These posts highlight ongoing innovations, governance developments, and tools that will have a lasting impact on Optimismdaospaceis a DAO discovery platform that aggregates contributions across different DAOs. We will be providing weekly Automated AI Summaries to help reduce information overload, and so that all members can stay up to date on forum activity within the DAO. Below is a summary of every topic made within the OP Governance Forum from last week.Feel free to leave us feedback in the comments below. You can get in touch with the daospace team onX (Twitter), or reach out to the founders directly on X as well:Jaris James&SixtyCYBER - Delegate Communication ThreadCreated: 2024-10-07Author:@CyberSummaryRoy Shen, head of growth at Cyber, is introducing Cyber as a delegate in the Optimism Collective, expressing excitement to contribute to the ecosystem’s growth. Cyber, known as the L2 for Social, aims to make web3 more social by bringing new users on-chain. They commit to open communication, sharing voting intents, decision explanations, and welcoming feedback from the community.Retro Funding 6: Impact Attestation experimentCreated: 2024-10-07Author: systemSummaryThe post discusses an experiment in Retro Funding 6 where impact attestations from governance actors will be collected to generate standardized, verifiable data on the impact of Governance Infrastructure & Tooling projects. The goal is to provide valuable insights to badgeholders for voting decisions. The experiment will involve participation from top delegates, citizens, and governance leadership roles, with the data generated through Impact Garden. The experiment aims to measure success based on feedback from badgeholders and looks towards future iterations that focus on rich reputation graphs, broad participation, and integration of impact signals into the user experience.Token Economics: Exploring the Path to Mass Adoption in Web3Created: 2024-10-07Author:@xiaohSummaryThe post discusses the concept of the consensus economy and proposes a reevaluation of the airdrop model to drive mass adoption of Web 3 products. It suggests implementing mass adopter airdrops in major Web 2 products to encourage Web 3 payment options. The post also explores areas for improvement in user attraction, such as airdrop probability algorithms, token lock-up periods, rebate ratios, and distributing equity or bonds. The ultimate goal is to create a sustainable Web 3 adoption strategy that motivates users as stakeholders and fosters a sense of ownership.Voting UX for Retro Funding 5Created: 2024-10-08Author:@shaunSummaryThe Optimism Foundation designed a new Voting UX for badgeholders in the Retro Funding 5: OP Stack initiative to enable more focus and better decision-making among voters. Through various enhancements like voting subcategories, impact scoring, and allocation methods, the process was streamlined, reducing cognitive load and improving voter confidence. The revamped system saw 79 projects approved across three categories, with badgeholders having to review fewer projects and make budget and category distribution decisions. The new system aims to increase focus and aid in better decision-making, ultimately enhancing voter confidence.Superchain Product VisionCreated: 2024-10-08Author: systemSummaryThe post outlines the product vision for Superchain, an Ethereum-based network of chains united by Optimism Governance. It highlights core principles for building the Superchain, such as chain standardization, decentralized governance, and scalable transaction capabilities. The vision emphasizes collaboration among contributors and governance mechanisms to ensure security, sustainability, and growth for the Superchain ecosystem.Code of Conduct Council accountability reports S6Created: 2024-10-08Author:@CodeofConductCouncilSummaryThe post provides a mid-season report from the Code of Conduct Council for season 6. It covers various aspects such as assessment of milestones, impact evaluation, proposed changes to procedures and the charter, self-evaluation, recommendations, and the council’s role in conflict management within the Optimism collective. The report highlights achievements, challenges, recommendations for improvement, and future directions for the council’s work.At this point it is just a fact that OP hates my walletCreated: 2024-10-09Author: Valueinvestor.ethSummaryThe user is expressing frustration over not receiving a cent in the optimism airdrop, despite believing they are eligible. They ask for their wallet to be checked in case they qualify, as they see that it potentially qualifies for a $5 airdrop but without clear confirmation.Final closure from OP before I leave. it is DEFI so stop hiding my threads… lCreated: 2024-10-09Author: Valueinvestor.ethSummaryThe user is expressing frustration at being seemingly overlooked or banned from a decentralized finance platform despite being an active participant. They share their wallet address and seek confirmation if they have been blacklisted or are unwelcome.GovNFT Community Call Thread 6Created: 2024-10-09Author: MichaelSummaryThe post discusses the implementation of the Impact Attestations experiment in Retro Funding round 6 by GovNFT participants. It asks for insights on using Impact Garden for top delegates and badgeholders to provide attestations for projects, and whether these attestations should be anonymous or public. Links to relevant resources are provided for further information.Cycle 28 Grants Final RoundupCreated: 2024-10-09Author: Gonna.ethSummaryCycle 28 milestones have all been achieved on time, with key statistics showing 53 total applications received, 32 approved, and 8 applications approved. Mint Blockchain secured a Superchain grant. A new mission request is open for applications and the budget for the season is allocated, with no further rolling mission requests. The Foundation OPs Team and Govnerds were thanked for their support. Multiple applications were listed, with some pending and others approved.Voting Cycle Roundup #29Created: 2024-10-10Author: systemSummaryCycle#29began on October 10th at 19:00 GMT and will run until October 30th at 19:00 GMT. There is a one-week veto period for the Citizens’ House to reject any Upgrades approved by the Token House. Delegate voting weights will be snapshot at the start of the voting period on October 24th at 19:00 GMT. Voting will take place athttps://vote.optimism.io/. The Citizens’ House veto vote will happen from October 31st to November 6th via Snapshot.Airdrop #5 Feedback ThreadCreated: 2024-10-10Author: cp0x-AlexQSummaryThe user created a forum thread seeking clarification on the conditions for receiving the drop rewards, specifically asking about the combination of Bonus Rewards and Base Rewards, potential address exclusions, and what actions users should take if they believe they meet requirements but are not on the list.Create your own Developer Reputation Scores - OpenRank Web Tool IntroCreated: 2024-10-10Author: gloriakwSummaryThe post discusses the introduction of reputation scores for developers and GitHub repositories based on recursive trust signals calculated from the GitHub developer activity graph. These scores, generated using a variation of the EigenTrust algorithm, aim to provide better signals for voters to assess the contributions and interactions of repositories and developers within the OP Stack ecosystem. A tool is also introduced to allow users to create their own custom reputation scores by selecting ranking criteria, seed trust, and seed strength values. Additionally, information is provided on accessing the existing Retro 5 scores and details on the historical datasets used for generating these metrics.Formal request after being ignored 24hrsCreated: 2024-10-10Author: Valueinvestor.ethSummaryThe user is contesting the exclusion of their wallet from Airdrop 5 by the Optimism “Foundation,” presenting detailed on-chain activity data to support their claim as a “power user” meeting the criteria. They request a review, explanation for exclusion, and possible rectification. Feeling ignored on various platforms, they seek relief and question oversight mechanisms to address unfairness in distributions, especially compared to experiences of scams receiving substantial amounts.Rewards for usersCreated: 2024-10-10Author:@kamgkamSummaryThe post discusses the bullish outlook for the ecosystem in round 6 and suggests ways for users to engage more. It also raises the topic of discussing which dapps and protocols are more rewarding for users. The author is seeking clarity and ease in understanding these aspects.RF6 Season 5 Grants Council ReportCreated: 2024-10-11Author: Gonna.ethSummarySummary: The Grants Council performance document for RF 6 reveals that over 530 applications were received, with 128 grants and 5 smart contract audit services approved. Key highlights include a high percentage of mission requests authored or sponsored by the Council and a Net Promoter Score of 9/10 from finalists. Breakdown by cycle shows details for Cycle 19 and Cycle 22, including the number of applications received, passed to review stages, and approved applications.Censorship free EVMCreated: 2024-10-11Author: Valueinvestor.ethSummaryThe post consists of an image with the filename “IMG_36791170” showing decentralized individuals. The caption implies difficulty in taking them seriously.Looking Ahead: Long-term Onchain Governance ArchitectureCreated: 2024-10-11Author: systemSummaryThe post discusses the vision and updates for the long-term onchain governance architecture within the ecosystem. It highlights the importance of proposal permissioning, the challenges of a direct move to permissionless proposals, and proposes a more granular approach to onchain governance. The post outlines steps for achieving this vision, addresses open questions, and explores future work in expanding the governance toolkit. The goal is to create a robust, transparent, and flexible governance model that engages the community effectively.Mid-Season 6 Grants Council ReportCreated: 2024-10-11Author: Gonna.ethSummaryThe post shares key numbers and progress from Grants Council Season 6, detailing the total applications received, number of grants approved, Superchain grants approved, mission requests reviewed, and projects reviewed by the Milestone and Metrics Subcommittee. It breaks down the data by cycles 25 to 28, including the total applications, approvals, and Superchain applications for each cycle.Unlocking Optimism’s Superchain: Podcast Series on the Future of Layer 2 ScalingCreated: 2024-10-13Author:@rippr.ethSummaryToken Trails introduces a new podcast series dedicated to exploring Optimism’s Superchain, delving into its technology, real-world applications, and impact on Ethereum. The series will cover topics such as the OP Stack, security innovations, interconnected L2s, and how Superchain could benefit DeFi, gaming, and NFTs. The first episode discusses the basics of Superchain, the OP Stack, security features, and scalability implications. Superchain aims to simplify development on Ethereum and enhance user experience. Listeners are encouraged to join the conversation and learn more about Superchain through the podcast and additional resources provided.Revenue Opportunities for the Optimism CollectiveCreated: 2024-10-13Author:@alexsotodigitalSummaryThe post discusses the proposal for accelerating decentralization on Optimism and the anticipation of sequencer fees going to 0. The proposal suggests a structured approach following a collective proposal creation model to explore alternative revenue streams for the sustainability of the collective. It outlines steps and dimensions to consider for developing a successful revenue model that aligns with the collective’s goals. The post encourages a deeper conversation among stakeholders to generate innovative solutions for sustainable value addition to the ecosystem.List of OP GrantCreated: 2024-10-13Author: inuinu_kunkunkunSummaryThe user is seeking information on where they can find a list of OP (Original Poster) grants.Please sponsor the mission of spreading cryptocurrency!Created: 2024-10-13Author: lsb108SummaryKevin, with over 8 years of cryptocurrency experience, has been writing articles for 2 years to help the community engage in Testnet, Retro, and more. He is seeking sponsorship from OP to continue his voluntary contributions and guide others to participate in cryptocurrency projects safely, preventing scams. Kevin shares his work on various platforms like Medium and Substack.

Article Name: Joint House Call will be [Tuesday, October 8th @ 11:00 PT / 14:00 ET / 18:00 GMT / 20:00 CET]
Article Content: Hey Optimists!Join us our next community call on October 8th! We will be discussing Retrofunding rounds 5 and 6!Google meet:https://meet.google.com/vme-ovto-jcnJointhcc16dccrf6912×365 39.8 KBFeel free to comment below if you want anything added to the agenda.See you there!Michael

Zenbit840×280 128 KBTL, DRZenbit is an R&D laboratory building public goods for cities. We have been deploying our contracts in the Optimism network and testnet since 2022, and now we are building Zenbit Badges, a dapp to attest in OP Mainnet the progress of new users in their journey to use decentralized technologies; along with OPcity, a research, and implementation of the OP stack that aims to expand the Fault Proofs memory capabilities to manage disputes from OPml and oppAI states along with the ones produced by OP geth. We will share updates on these projects in this post.1. About UsZenbit beganby addressing the needs of a neighborhood in Querétaro, Mexico, collaborating with residents and local government to implement transparent and sustainable solutions. Over time,we have evolvedinto an organization that connects regional and international talent to build decentralized infrastructure and applications using Open Source Software (OSS) and advanced Ethereum tools, aiming to improve urban management and enhance citizens’ quality of life.Zenbit ReportsZenbit Report # 1Zenbit Report # 2Zenbit Contributors@habacuc.eth/Founder, R&D@kira/Protocol EngineerAlessandro/Smart Contracts and Backend DevMarcos/Software EngineerDharmik/Software EngineerMaggie / IP and OperationsZenbit Onchainzenbit.ethZenbit multisigZenbit treasuryPrevious contributions to the OP CollectiveZengo:A platform for managing public proposals for improving urban spaces and their positive impact on decentralized urban governance. We participated in this project in Retro PGF3.Zengo Code RepoZengo @ OP RetroPGF3Eneagon:A proof of concept of a pre-filtering solution for public goods funding that enables builders to connect with their stakeholders with code upgrades and onchain data. We participated in this project in RetroPGF2.Eneagon Code RepoEneagon @ OP RetroPGF22. Ongoing OP projects:OP city:A research and implementation of the OP stack to develop a rollup dedicated to cities. It integrates functionalities for Large Language Models (LLM) inferences in public data processing throughOptimistic Machine Learning (opML)and provides privacy tools via ZK andOptimistic Privacy-Preserving AI (oppAI). We will research the compatibility of the OP stack’s Canon Fault Proof VM with the opML’s Multi-Phase Fault Proof protocol. The goal is to implement a custom Fault Dispute Game that manages the challenges related to data availability states from the L2 rollup and the computation results from the Deep Neural Networks (DNN) of the multi-phase opML. This project was proposed in collaboration with Dr. Cathie for aBuilders Grant during Season 5in Intent 1: Progress towards technical decentralization, which wasgranted during cycle 22. It will be developed over 12 months starting this month.OP City Stack governance proposalOP City Stack milestonesZenbit Badges:An on-chain platform deployed on the OP mainnet, using the Ethereum Attestation Service (EAS) for skills certification, leveraging Optimism’s infrastructure. It has a contract deployed on the OP mainnet that allows registering events, mentors, and participants to issue automated attestations on behalf of badges.zenbit.eth. It currently verifies Optimism Onboarding and DAO Formation.Zenbit Badges contract (OP mainnet)Optimism Onboarding Badge /EAS Schema #423DAO Formation Badge /EAS Schema #424Zenbit Badges GitHubZenbit Badges Platform3. Other initiativesWe have also participated in other initiatives related to the Decentralized Technologies ecosystem:Development of Fundcaster during theFrames Hackathon 2024, a Frame that facilitates the creation of funding campaigns on the Farcaster social network.Participation in Optimism’s “We Love the Art” contest, presenting“Zenbit City”an AI-generated artwork representing our vision of integrating public goods in urban environments.For the next 12 months, Zenbit will focus on the integral development of Zenbit Badges and OP City Stack. We plan to collaborate closely with local universities, research centers, and civil organizations to promote the adoption of decentralized technologies, facilitate connections between emerging regional talents and global experts, and encourage technology transfer of the OP stack. In this post we will publishing updates for our projects related to the Superchain, we appreciate any feedback about our work and lets connect if you are interested in contributing to any of these developments.Stay Optimistic!

gm Optimism CollectiveLast week, forum activity increased with 19 new topics, up from 16 the previous week. Here are some of the most impactful discussions:Zk Toolkit for ZK Application Developers: Mission updatesby@WakeUp_LabsThis mission update introduces a toolkit designed for developers working on Zero-Knowledge (ZK) applications within the Superchain. Focused on self-sovereign identity and privacy, the toolkit will empower developers to create more secure, privacy-focused decentralized applications (dApps), pushing the boundaries of innovation on Optimism.New Explorer for the OP Stack: Milestone 3 submission and request for feedbackby@romanmThe Walnut team reached Milestone 3 of their open-source explorer for the OP Stack, including features like token holdings and contract verification. The post invites feedback and aims to improve the user experience, encouraging rollup teams to explore its functionality.RPC Nodes Management Toolsby@pcGBThis post outlines effective strategies for managing RPC nodes to ensure high availability and minimal downtime, highlighting GetBlock’s techniques for maintaining 99% node uptime. It offers valuable insights for developers aiming to optimize their node infrastructure on the Superchain.These updates reflect key improvements in infrastructure, privacy, and tooling that support developer growth and innovation within the Optimism ecosystem.daospaceis a DAO discovery platform that aggregates contributions across different DAOs. We will be providing weekly Automated AI Summaries to help reduce information overload, and so that all members can stay up to date on forum activity within the DAO. Below is a summary of every topic made within the OP Governance Forum from last week.Feel free to leave us feedback in the comments below. You can get in touch with the daospace team onX (Twitter), or reach out to the founders directly on X as well:Jaris James&SixtyMatt L - Delegate Communication ThreadCreated: 2024-09-23Author:@MattLSummaryThe post introduces the user as a DeFi enthusiast, governance contributor, and councilor. They share their prominent wallets and discuss their role as a Synthetix Ambassador. They address potential conflicts of interest due to their involvement in various ecosystem projects and express their goal to provide transparency in their voting decisions and clarify the Synthetix Ambassadors’ role in governance.Cycle 28 Intent 3A Mission Request and SponsorshipCreated: 2024-09-23Author: Gonna.ethSummaryThe post discusses how to propose mission requests to the Grants Council for consideration, detailing the steps and requirements for submission, including using a provided template, specific tags, and budget information.Cycle 28 Grants Council Audits implementationCreated: 2024-09-23Author: Gonna.ethSummaryThe post announces the opening of applications for whitelisting and mission requests for a new audit mission request process approved by the Token House. The process simplifies audit requests by allowing auditors to apply for specific audits directly, without the need for pre-approved budgets. Applicants must go through a whitelisting process and meet specific criteria to be eligible for audits, aiming to support projects launching on the Superchain ecosystem.New Explorer for the OP Stack: Milestone 3 submission and request for feedbackCreated: 2024-09-25Author: romanmSummaryThe post announces reaching Milestone 3 of the OP Scan 1 project by the Walnut team, which is an open-source explorer for the OP Stack. Milestone 3 included features like token holdings, contract verification, and more. The next focus is on UX improvements and encouraging user feedback. Rollup teams building on the OP Stack are invited to try out the explorer. Contact details for further engagement are provided.[Looking for sponsor] Creating educational and onboarding contents about OP governance modelCreated: 2024-09-25Author:@JeheeSummaryThe post provides a detailed guide on creating Mission Requests within the Optimism Collective for Season 6, outlining the definition, creation process, who can create them, when they are created, and how they are approved. It also includes specific requirements, best practices, and a template for creating Mission Requests aligned with the Collective’s Intents. The post emphasizes the need for alignment with goals, specific guidelines for creating Requests, and the timeline for submission and approval.OptimismGovBot, bringing the Optimism Collective Forum to TwitterCreated: 2024-09-26Author:@destroyrSummaryIntroducing OptimismGovBot, a new Twitter bot dedicated to providing concise summaries and direct links to the latest posts from the Optimism Collective Forum, helping users stay informed and engaged with governance activities in the community.Retro Funding 5: Voting Rationale ThreadCreated: 2024-09-26Author: systemSummaryThis post is about providing a space for badgeholders to discuss and share their voting rationale for Retro Funding 5. It includes relevant resources such as Retro Funding 5 information and OP Stack details.RPC Nodes Management ToolsCreated: 2024-09-26 06:42 AMAuthor: pcGBSummaryThe post explains how to manage RPC nodes effectively for optimal performance and minimal downtime using GetBlock as an example. It discusses the tools and strategies used by GetBlock, including Prometheus, Grafana, health sidecar, Alertmanager, loadservice, and auto-switching system to ensure high-speed RPC management. By following these techniques, GetBlock has been able to achieve 99% node availability. Additionally, the post suggests using GetBlock’s RPC node provider services for a hassle-free experience.[Looking for sponsor] Develop Onchain Social Games that Attract Builders to Optimism (v4)Created: 2024-09-26Author:@DanSingjoySummaryThe post outlines a mission request to develop engaging onchain social games on the Optimism platform to attract and nurture builders, fostering a vibrant developer community. It details how the games can help achieve this goal, the execution requirements, how to measure impact, milestones, metrics, and funding allocation for game developers. Additionally, it mentions eligibility criteria for game developers and contributions from community members in shaping the mission request.Joan’s RPGF5 ReflectionsCreated: 2024-09-26Author: joanbpSummaryThe post reflects on the RPGF 5 review process, discussing improvements made in clarity, objectivity, and consistency for reviewers. The author shares insights on the software tools, hours spent, and suggestions for future enhancements, including API access to data, handling projects fitting multiple categories, and ensuring transparency in the review process. They also highlight the benefits of predefined reviewer teams, private Telegram channels for discussions, and the ‘My Work’ tab in Charmverse, while mentioning specific areas for improvement like data integrity, application sorting, and bug fixes within the system.Call for Optimism Speakers [ETH Costa Rica]Created: 2024-09-26Author:@inbestprogram.ethSummaryThe post invites speakers to the Ethereum Pura Vida event in Costa Rica on October 26th. Organized by Optimism, the event aims to expand the impact of Optimism in the country. They are looking for international speakers to share insights on DeFi, governance, and the Optimism ecosystem. Side events and a hackathon will begin on October 19th, leading up to the main event. Interested speakers can submit their applications introducing themselves and their proposed topics.Superchain Interop is awesome!Created: 2024-09-27Author: MintSummaryThe post discusses the promotion and potential prosperity of the Superchain ecosystem, highlighting the seamless connectivity and interoperability of the L2 networks within Superchain. It emphasizes the importance of consumption scenarios and applications on each L2 network in attracting users and fostering a thriving ecosystem. Additionally, it predicts the growth of the Superchain economy and the development of NFT applications within the ecosystem.GovNFT Community Call Thread 5Created: 2024-09-27Author: MichaelSummaryThe post is a thread for the GovNFT community to discuss and share insights on the topic of the “Accelerated Decentralization Proposal For Optimism”. Participants are asked to answer questions about what Optimism needs to do to achieve Stage 2 decentralization and their thoughts on calls to decentralize at a faster pace. Relevant links to the Foundation response and other resources are provided, and participants are reminded that thoughtful responses earn points. The GovNFT participation program will be ending on October 18th.Impact Metrics for Retro Funding 5Created: 2024-09-27Author: ccerv1SummaryOpen Source Observer has introduced new impact metrics for Retro Funding 5, focusing on GitHub repo-level contributions, including basic GitHub stats, contributor counts, and trust-weighted metrics. The metrics provide data to complement projects’ self-reported impact statements, aiming to assist human voters in assessing project impact on the Optimism ecosystem. The analysis includes various fields such as contributor numbers, stars, forks, and trust-weighted scores. The caveats include reliance on public GitHub activity and variations due to project submission of multiple repos and public vs. private contribution data. Feedback and questions can be directed to their GitHub forum.Zk Toolkit for ZK Application Developers: Mission updatesCreated: 2024-09-27Author: WakeUp_LabsSummaryWakeUp Labs is developing a ZK Identity Toolkit for developers working on the Superchain, focusing on self-sovereign identity and privacy through zero-knowledge (ZK) technology integration into decentralized applications (dApps). The toolkit aims to empower individuals with full control over their identities and privacy. The project is part of the Optimism Missions, with updates shared on their communication channels.Questions - Regarding Community Calls Follow-upsCreated: 2024-09-27Author: windchange-incSummaryThe post is a message of appreciation to someone named Michael for their work in centralizing information about the Optimism Collective community calls. The author poses questions about finding follow-up commitments from the calls, accessing recordings and specific presentation topics, as well as asking post-call questions without cluttering the main thread. They also express interest in discussing hosting opportunities.“Encircling the Cities from the Countryside” — A Strategic Approach to Blockchain Project AdoptionCreated: 2024-09-28Author:@xiaohSummaryThe post discusses the challenges of building large-scale social or entertainment products in the current monopolized Web 2 landscape. It proposes that blockchain technology can find success by targeting peripheral markets, leveraging fan-driven economies and competitive gaming to tap into an underserved audience and drive broader blockchain adoption.Blockchain Game Concept: AI-Generated Treasure HuntCreated: 2024-09-28Author: xiaohSummaryThe post describes a game centered around AI-generated maps for treasure hunting, with the goal of finding a rare and valuable “Grand Treasure Chest.” Players collaborate with friends and family to locate the chest, promoting community engagement. The game also incorporates a paid product system to create an internal economic loop, transforming traditional blockchain mining into human-powered mining, aligning with blockchain’s decentralized concept. This concept combines discovery, social gaming, and economic incentives for community involvement.Badgeholder Onchain AnalysisCreated: 2024-09-28Author:@jason42SummaryThe research analysis conducted by the Optimism Foundation explores the on-chain behaviors of Badgeholders in the Superchain ecosystem compared to Non-Badgeholders on various chains. Despite having significant account age, Badgeholders exhibit lower overall activity levels, preferring Ethereum transactions and limited DEX platform usage. The study highlights the high social engagement of Badgeholders, particularly in connection with Farcaster. The findings aim to assist the Optimism Collective in developing strategies to increase Badgeholder participation and integration in the Superchain ecosystem.

Article Name: Data and Analytics Tooling for OP Mainnet and the Superchain
Article Content: Hello all. We’re Token Flow, a data and analytics company that participated in RFG 1 of Season 4 (Onchain Data Tools & UI).UpdateOur proposal was to build tools to allow the community to analyze the full history of smart contracts on OP Mainnet through an Explorer and Data Platform.This functionality is now available to the community in two ways:Token Flow StudioStudio is a UI that replaces the envisaged explorer with a SQL editor that allows users to create much more flexible queries, charts and boards using decoded datasets for all blocks, transactions, events and calls from genesis onwards.Users can see the whole history of a contract, or search by address, transaction, block and many other parameters.In addition to OP Mainnet, also Base, Blast, Manta, Mint, Mode, Syndicate-Frame and Zora have been added to Studio outside the grant, with more Superchain and OP Stack L2s and L3s being added.Studio goes beyond what was originally envisaged with Explorer and APIs, and allows core teams and the wider community to conduct and share analysis at the cross-chain, chain, contract, or multi-contract level.Examples are shown below using OP Mainnet and Mode data (in progress):Cross chainState of SuperchainChainState of OptimismState of ModeProtocol / ContractEtherFi on ModeBMX perps on ModeMulti-protocol / contractDEXs on ModePerps competition on ModeA free plan is available to core teams, analysts and community members for non-commercial uses. The free plan is rate and query speed limited. Higher performance paid plans may also be offered in the future.Token Flow Data PlatformOP Mainnet blocks, transactions, events and calls are also available as full datasets via Snowflake in our Data Platform.Given how granular they are, these datasets are huge. For OP Mainnet and the OP Stack chains listed above, we have processed and host over 34 billion rows and 4.07 terrabytes of data (as at early September 2024).A free plan is available for non-commercial and non-redistribution use for OP Mainnet data (no charges from Token Flow, but Snowflake does charge computation cost). Other OP Stack chains are available on request.By sharing in this way users only pay for their own computation from conducting analysis, and Token Flow pays for storage.How to get startedStudiocan be accessedhere, and anyone can create an account. Once you have your account you can start a new query (which can then be added to a board), deciding whether you want it to be public or private. In the left side menu you will see Optimism Mainnet and all the other available chains (circled in red):Screenshot 2024-09-30 at 18.39.111920×873 122 KBForData Platformyou can contact us using the “get more info” formhereand we will discuss with you what is available and how the data is shared via Snowflake.For these products, and our others, you can find additionalinformation and supporthere:Documentation:https://docs.tokenflow.live/Support channel (and support bot) in our Discord server (link from docs or homepage - can only add 10 links here in a forum post).Want your OP Stack chain added?If you are an OP Stack chain that we don’t yet cover and you want to be added to Studio get in contact with us - typically we can add newer L2s/L3s within days.Our thanksWe thank the community and grants committee for supporting the inclusion of OP Mainnet data in these two products, and are happy to make them available to the ecosystem.Thanks also to the Grants Committee and the Milestones and Metrics Sub-Committee for their constructive approach in the amendment in how we delivered the functionality (e.g. Studio with broader capabilities rather than Explorer with more narrow abilities). (Tagging@PGovfor visibility).We encourage the community to try out Studio, and those with more intensive data needs to contact us about Data Platform access. If you have feedback or feature requests let us know via the support bot in our Discord server.We look forward to seeing what you build!

gm Optimism CollectiveLast week, forum engagement increased with 15 new topics created, up from 11 the previous week. The most impactful discussions included:Accelerated Decentralization Proposal For Optimism: This proposal outlines a comprehensive plan to accelerate the decentralization of governance within Optimism. It focuses on transferring ownership of key governance powers and OP token governance contracts to the community by 2025, promoting a more decentralized and transparent governance system.Retro Funding 6: Governance - Round Details: Retro Funding Round 6 focuses on rewarding contributions to Optimism’s governance, covering categories like governance infrastructure, analytics, and leadership. The post provides details on eligibility, funding size, voting design, and processes to ensure impactful participation in governance improvements.Introducing GovGraph.fyi – Citizen Connections Visualized: GovGraph.fyi is a new tool designed to visualize governance connections within the Optimism ecosystem. It offers interactive features for mapping relationships and enhancing transparency, helping users better understand governance dynamics and participation.daospaceis a DAO discovery platform that aggregates contributions across different DAOs. We will be providing weekly Automated AI Summaries to help reduce information overload, and so that all members can stay up to date on forum activity within the DAO. Below is a summary of every topic made within the OP Governance Forum from last week.Feel free to leave us feedback in the comments below. You can get in touch with the daospace team onX (Twitter), or reach out to the founders directly on X as well:Jaris James&SixtyRetro Funding 6: Governance - Round detailsCreated: 2024-09-16Author: systemSummaryThe post provides information about the Retroactive Public Goods Funding (Retro Funding) 6 program, which rewards contributions to Optimism Governance in categories such as governance infrastructure & tooling, governance analytics, and governance leadership. The timeline, eligibility criteria, scope categories, size of funding, voting design, and KYC & Grant Delivery process are detailed, along with examples and specific rules for each category.Optimism Retro Funding – Voting Design EvaluationCreated: 2024-09-16Author:@akrtwsSummaryThe post provides information about an upcoming workshop for Optimism Badgeholders and GovNERDs on evaluating voting designs for Optimism Retro Funding rounds. The workshop will cover insights from past rounds, a new evaluation framework based on Social Choice Theory, and data-driven proposals for improving voting designs and performance metrics. The event aims to help participants understand and optimize voting behavior for future rounds of Retro Funding.How are attestations being used within Optimisms grant system?Created: 2024-09-17Author:@0xRSummaryThe user is seeking information on leveraging attestation systems within Optimism grants and governance, specifically looking for documentation on how attestations are used in Optimism’s governance systems. They are requesting assistance from experts familiar with grants and governance.Accelerated Decentralization Proposal For OptimismCreated: 2024-09-17Author:@GFXlabsSummaryThe post discusses a proposal for accelerated decentralization of governance powers within Optimism, focusing on transferring system powers, resources, and access to governance to promote decentralization and rejuvenation of the system. The proposal outlines three phases of decentralization to be completed by summer 2025, including immediate actions such as transferring ownership of the OP token and governance contracts, as well as future steps like bringing bridge escrow assets under governance control and decentralizing the sequencer by Q2 2025. The ultimate goal is to give full control of the Optimism protocol to governance and ensure transparency through processes like disclosing past grants. Users holding the OP token are encouraged to signal approval for this decentralization plan.Voting Cycle Roundup #28Created: 2024-09-18Author: systemSummaryCycle#28began on September 19th at 19:00 GMT and will end on October 9th at 19:00 GMT. The Citizens’ House will have a one-week period to veto any Upgrades approved by the Token House after the Token House Voting Period. Delegate voting weights will be snapshot at the beginning of voting on October 3rd at 19:00 GMT. The Citizens’ House veto vote will take place from October 10th to October 16th via Snapshot.About the Foundation Budgets categoryCreated: 2024-09-18Author:@lavandeSummaryThis post provides guidelines for creating a new category on a forum or website. It highlights the importance of the category, differentiates it from existing ones, outlines the content that should be included in topics, and explores the necessity of this new category or potential merging with an existing one.Cycle 27 Grants final roundupCreated: 2024-09-18Author:@Gonna.ethSummaryThe post highlights the successful review of all applications, including Rolling Mission Requests, with 53 applications received and 16 approved. The team met all deadlines thanks to the Developer Advisory Board’s valuable feedback. Congratulations were extended to grant recipients, and Cycle 28 is now open for new Mission Requests submissions. A new whitelisting process for Auditors is forthcoming. Submissions for Cycle 28 close on Tuesday, the 24th at 19:00 GMT, with the finalists listed in the post.[Request for Feedback] Syntra – Setting a New Standard for DAO ParticipationCreated: 2024-09-18Author:@SEEDGovSummarySyntra 1 is a delegate dashboard created to address the fragmented experience of DAO governance tools by offering a unified solution focused on people. Key features include simplified proposal drafting, comprehensive onboarding, a unified interface, and insights and analysis. The goal is to make DAO participation more accessible and effective, catering to both newcomers and professional delegates. The expected outcomes include increased participation and deliberation, greater transparency and accountability, and optimized token utilization. Syntra integrates with existing solutions in the DAO space and aims to provide a comprehensive governance hub in the future. Feedback and ideas are welcomed to continue refining the platform.Sov - Delegate Communication ThreadCreated: 2024-09-18Author:@SovSummaryThe post is an introduction from@SovereignSignal, a delegate in the Optimism community. They have a professional background in operations, grant program development, and management and currently work at Gitcoin. They are committed to active participation in governance discussions and encourage communication through Telegram. They also disclose potential conflicts of interest related to holding OP tokens and working for Gitcoin. Updates will be posted in the thread as needed.Where are the Optimisms main treasury addresses?Created: 2024-09-18Author: 0xRSummaryThe user is seeking information on the treasury address of the OP foundation or the main treasury addresses of the Optimism Collective for research purposes. They are reaching out on the forum to see if any experts can provide this information as they have been unable to find it through their search.Badgeholder Onchain Analysis ReportCreated: 2024-09-18Author:@wheebillSummaryThe post discusses the On-Chain Analysis of Optimism Badgeholders and their role in the OP Collective. The study compares Badgeholders to typical active OP users in terms of transaction activity, DAO participation, social app usage, and NFT & Smart Contract activity. The findings show that Badgeholders are more engaged in governance, social platforms, NFTs, and smart contract creation, providing valuable insight for governance decisions and future Retrofunding rounds.Introducing GovGraph.fyi – Citizen Connections VisualizedCreated: 2024-09-18Author:@maxsemenchukSummaryIntroducing GovGraph.fyi, a dynamic tool for visualizing governance ecosystems, focusing on Optimism’s ecosystem. It offers interactive relationship mapping, advanced filtering, and transparency enhancement features. Users are encouraged to explore the demo, provide feedback, and suggest new features. Collaboration between Trusted Seed and General Magic, the tool aims to enhance governance transparency and accessibility. Visithttps://govgraph.fyi/for more information.Token House Call will be [Tuesday, September 24th @ 11:00 PT / 14:00 ET / 18:00 GMT / 20:00 CET]Created: 2024-09-19Author: MichaelSummaryThe post announces a token house call scheduled for the upcoming Tuesday and invites participants to comment with any specific topics they would like to discuss. The meeting will be held via Google Meet, with the provided link. The post is signed by Michael.GovNFT Governance Topic Thread 2Created: 2024-09-19Author: MichaelSummaryThe post invites GovNFT participants to discuss Retro Funding Round 6 focused on projects impacting Optimism Governance. The round size will be determined by badgeholders/citizens, ranging from 1.1M OP to 3.5M OP. A new experiment with “guest voters” is introduced. Participants are asked their opinions on the round’s funding amount and including random farcaster users as voters, emphasizing thoughtful answers to earn points on the leaderboard.Pairwise in Retro Funding 5: Your Voting ToolCreated: 2024-09-19Author: ZeptimusSummaryIn Retro Funding 5, badgeholders can use Pairwise, an open-source voting dapp, to simplify their voting experience. Pairwise enables users to rank projects by comparing them in pairs using star ratings to categorize their impact on the OP stack. After ranking projects, users can unlock their ballot and finalize their vote in the Main UI. Your participation in Retro Funding 5 using Pairwise is essential, and feedback is welcome for improvement.

Article Name: New Explorer for the OP Stack: Milestone 3 submission and request for feedback
Article Content: GM Optimism!On behalf of theWalnutteam, I am excited to announce that we have reached Milestone 3 of theOP Scanproject, which  received anOP grant in Season 5, cycle 19.In this post, we detail what has been delivered and what’s next. We encourage you to try out the tool (instructions below) and share your feedback.TL;DR: What is OP Scan?OP Scan is a new, lightweight, local, and fully open-source explorer for the OP Stack. It runs on a laptop, enabling anyone building OP Stack chains to connect and explore transactions locally. Once production-ready, Rollup-as-a-Service providers can also use it for their chains. The code is well-crafted and structured, making it easy for anyone to customize.Milestones OverviewMilestone 1: Build the MVP(link to announcement)Milestone 2: Expanded tx Detail Page(link to announcement)Milestone 3: Expanded contract detail page with contract verification ←this announcementMilestone 4: UX improvements, Documentation, Superchain ←up nextWhat we delivered in Milestone 3The third Milestone was all about building the address page to correctly display info about EOAs and Contracts deployed on the OP Stack. We implemented token holdings, transactions overview, token transfers (ERC20), NFT transfers (ERC721/1155) and events emitted by contracts. We also built a verify contract page powered bySourcifyto provide contract verification alongside a verified contract page displaying the contract source code and ABI.You can test a live version of the explorer configured for optimism sepoliahere. (there’s no indexer being run in parallel though so it won’t update in realtime).List of transactions for an EOA.1540×974 84.3 KBList of ERC20 transfers.1540×974 75.3 KBList of ERC721/1155 transfers.1540×974 63.4 KBEvents emitted by a contract.1522×1000 88.1 KBContract verification step 11540×974 54.1 KBContract verification step 21540×974 65.9 KBContract verified page.1525×2680 339 KBWhat’s nextYou can review all of the upcoming milestones and deliverables onCharmVerse.Notably, in the next milestone, we will focus polishing the UX and adding fancy features like keyboard shortcuts for best UX.We also plan to encourage more users to test the product and share their feedback.CTA: Looking for Rollup Builders!If you know rollup teams building on the OP Stack, chances are they will be interested in this explorer. Here is why they could want it:Open source (= free)Etherscan-like UXLightweight & fast, runs locally on a laptopPlease make an intro!Contact details:GitHub:walnuthq/op-scanTelegram:Join Group ChatEmail: hi[at]walnut[dot]devX:@walnut_devStay optimistic!
